duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervise and coordinate the activities of the employees engaged in servicing and repairing equipment and vehicles.
Provide hands-on maintenance to assist the shop employees with the completion of their daily tasks.
Directly supervise all employees in the maintenance department through planning and directing work.
Establish and enforce a preventative maintenance program to ensure equipment is in safe and operable condition.
Maintain all vehicle inspection, maintenance and safety records required by federal, state/provincial or local agencies and Company policies.
Ensure that all work and the shop facility is compliant to safety standards.
Confer with Operations Supervisor/Management to arrange for equipment to be released from service for inspections, service and repair.
Schedule and conduct safety meetings and ensure employees follow safety guidelines.
Maintain cost-effective inventory of all supplies and parts and authorize and arrange for purchase of supplies, tools, parts, etc.
Oversee the maintenance and appearance of the shop facility and grounds.
Recruit, interview, hire and train all shop personnel.
Evaluate shop personnel and discipline when necessary.
Ensure compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws, regulations, ordinances, and company policies.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or GED required. Completion of DOT certification for air brake inspection and adjustment. Possess Class B Certified Driver's License (CDL) within 6 months of hire. Prior supervisory experience in a shop or maintenance setting desired. Full set of hand tools required. Knowledge of welding, compactor repair, air brake inspection, vehicle inspections.
